column3: Why not just catching this error by linter? The error can be caught whenever someone open a PR.

<!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 241 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.
Looks like this has many unaddressed comments. Added "Waiting for author" label.
@laanwj It looks like the author hasn't been very active on GitHub lately. I'm going to label this "Up for grabs" and close.

While sharing the vision of aiming for perfectionism, a proper "validation" of specifiers might be difficult, if going for more than a simple notification then I would also try to cover possible cases where the input data can be misinterpreted by missing a trailing space. I will think about a better while still easy solution and update the PR.
What exception `specifiers.append(s[percent+1])` is going to throw?
in certain cases string index out of range\nfor example if we have a % followed by ) - "%x stuff done (overall %p %)"
IMO we should check those cases instead of catching the exception.
translators accidentally like to sneak in a space after % as well, probably there's a solution to identify all of those errors. tbh I didn't think much about it recently
I don't see what other error could be thrown here. Just catch the one you know the code should produce.
you guys are absolutely right, I was thinking about doing some kind of auto-correct but better keep it simple but clean. sorry for not getting to it for a while
